skill.name: chronicle-session-documenter
skill.description: Document AI-assisted development sessions to Obsidian vault using Chronicle data. Works with MCP (fastest) or CLI commands (portable). Use when completing a coding session, creating development logs, or maintaining a knowledge base of past work. Automatically creates structured notes with metadata, summaries, and wikilinks.
skill.summary: Document AI-assisted development sessions to Obsidian vault using Chronicle data. Works with MCP (fa...
skill.author: ChandlerHardy

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. It defines MCP tool usage patterns for reading Chronicle session data and writing structured notes to Obsidian. No file system access, network calls, or code execution mechanisms detected.

content.value_statement: Developers lose context between AI-assisted sessions. This skill automatically creates structured Obsidian notes from Chronicle session data with summaries, wikilinks, and metadata for a searchable knowledge base.
actual_capabilities: Retrieve session summaries from Chronicle database via MCP or CLI
Create structured Markdown notes with YAML frontmatter
Generate wikilinks connecting sessions, commits, and repositories
Format session metadata including duration, tool, and timestamps
Auto-activate on prompts like document session or export to obsidian
limitations: Requires Chronicle MCP server or CLI installed and configured
Obsidian MCP server required for automated vault writing
Session summaries generate in background and may not be immediately available
Cannot document sessions without existing Chronicle records

use_cases.title: Document coding sessions
use_cases.description: Create searchable notes of AI-assisted work for future reference and context recovery

use_cases.title: Track project progress
use_cases.description: Build a knowledge base of development decisions and accomplishments across team sessions

use_cases.title: Generate session reports
use_cases.description: Extract structured summaries from AI sessions for documentation and process improvement

prompt_templates.title: Document recent session
prompt_templates.prompt: Document session [number] to my Obsidian vault

prompt_templates.title: Export today's work
prompt_templates.prompt: Export all today's sessions to Obsidian with summaries

prompt_templates.title: Find and document
prompt_templates.prompt: Find sessions about [topic] and document them to my vault

prompt_templates.title: Create linked notes
prompt_templates.prompt: Document the last 5 sessions and create wikilinks between them

output_examples.input: Document session 42 to my Obsidian vault
output: Summary: Implemented user authentication with OAuth integration

best_practices: Use structured frontmatter tags for filtering and Dataview queries in Obsidian
Extract key technical decisions and accomplishments from AI summaries for better searchability
Link related sessions and commits to build a connected knowledge graph
anti_patterns: Documenting sessions without waiting for summary generation (loses AI context)
Skipping wikilinks (breaks navigation between related sessions)
Using generic filenames instead of consistent Session-ID naming convention

faq.question: Which tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Claude Code, and any AI tool tracked by Chronicle database

faq.question: What data does Chronicle store?
faq.answer: Session transcripts, summaries, timestamps, durations, repository paths, and related commits

faq.question: How does the MCP approach differ from CLI?
faq.answer: MCP provides structured JSON for reliable parsing; CLI returns formatted text requiring manual extraction

faq.question: Is my session data secure?
faq.answer: Data stays local in your Chronicle database and Obsidian vault; no external transmission

faq.question: Why is my summary empty?
faq.answer: Summaries generate asynchronously after session ends; wait a few minutes for processing

faq.question: How is this different from manual note-taking?
faq.answer: Automates data extraction, ensures consistent formatting, and creates bidirectional links automatically
